chapter.title: Creating a Project From Scratch

abstract.para: The easiest way to set up a new documentation project from scratch is to use daps-init. This initialization script automatically creates the key files and directory structure you need to get started with the &dapsacr;.

listitem.para: an example that you can use as a starting point for your documentation.

chapter.para: By default, the initialization script creates a book as example document, but with the -r, you can also set another root element, such as article, for example.

Check your working directory for the new files and have a look at them: The text file DC-daps-example is annotated and gives you a rough idea which options can be defined in a DC-* file. Change to the xml subdirectory and open MAIN-DC-daps-example.xml in your favorite editor to explore its contents.
